comment: These are consistently very good to great and often amazing... You won’t be disappointed...
Polite Pig (Orlando) Barrel Pick: caramel, candy, creamy smooth finish @ 118PF. Very good!

Purchased 4/28/18
(Richmond, Va $89.99)
This is the Barrel Strength version but I can’t find it on this app.  114.8 proof
Easily one of my top three favorites, only surpassed by Old Forrester, Prohibition.
Love whistle pig. The name. The whiskey. The smell. The everything. Very smooth, sweet, inviting...easy to drink neat

Sweet tobacco. Honey. Smooth rye and oak. Doesn't burn at all for 117.3 proof. Very good mouthfeel. Long lasting finish. 

Select by State of NH in 2018. Proof 117.3.
Very smooth finish with caramel.  Good neat.
First, finish is easy and floral.  finish has better flavor but not memorable.  good not great
Maple syrup nose. Got tons of heat. Great mouthfeel.
sweet and delicious. A bit hot but expected from a barrel strength.
Really unique flavors you don't normally expect in a whiskey. I got pine on the nose and rosemary fromt the taste. Will try again.

Caramel on the nose
Slightly sweet and oaky on the tongue
Rich finish

Honey. Ginger. Black Pepper. Some heat. Medium sweetness. Finishes dry.

Select by State of NH in 2018. Proof 108.6.

13 year MGP single barrel store pick- Bob’s Lake City Liquor

Nose- maple syrup, candy corn, caramel, milk chocolate, baking spices

Palate- maple syrup, sweet bread, caramel, wet oak, cinnamon, marshmallows, honey

Finish- Medium, spicy finish with notes of baking spices and maple syrup

All around delicious, big step up from regular whistle pig. Lots of maple syrup and baking spices
Good flavor! great with a cigar

Got a bottle for poppa for his birthday and he wasn’t impressed. He let me have it back and I’m aging it in my oak barrel to ease the bite. 

I’m not all that impressed either. Lots of burn and not great flavors, at least to my pallet. 

I tried the boss hog a few years ago and it blew me away so I assumed this would be up there with it, I assumed wrong.

3rd bottle of my Christmas whiskey share ($80ish bottles).

Nose is warm buttery spices, caramel, vanilla, and an acetone note.

Taste is sour grain, grass, heavy spices, and leather.

Finish is long and fairly hot but enjoyable.

Great rye whiskey.
Personally my favorite Whiskey. Bring on that spicey Rye!
